item.title: Marvel’s Wolverine creative director Brian Horton moves to Perfect Dark
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/10/marvels-wolverine-creative-director-brian-horton-moves-to-perfect-dark

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Marcus Smith will now serve as creative director, with Mike Daly as game director.

Brian Horton, who was announced as the creative director of publisher Sony Interactive Entertainment and developer Insomniac Games‘ Marvel’s Wolverine in 2021, has been off the project since summer and is now the creative director of publisher Xbox Game Studios and developer The Initiative‘s Perfect Dark, according to a Game File report.

Marvel’s Wolverine is now helmed by creative director Marcus Smith, which a Sony Interactive Entertainment representative confirmed to Game File. Mike Daly will also now serve as game director in place of previous director Cameron Christian, who remains at Insomniac Games, but in a different role.

Marcus Smith was previously a creative director on Marvel’s Spider-Man, Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales, Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart, and Marvel’s Spider-Man 2. Mike Daly was previously a lead designer on Marvel’s Spider-Man and Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales, as well as a game director on Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart and Marvel’s Spider-Man 2.

According to Game File’s sources, the changes on the Marvel’s Wolverine development team are the result of creative decisions around the game. The Sony Interactive Entertainment representative who confirmed the new roles declined to comment on the reason for the role changes.

As for Perfect Dark, a Microsoft Gaming representative told Game File that Horton will be “bringing his wealth of experience to the upcoming reboot of the classic secret agent series.”

Marvel’s Wolverine will be available for PlayStation 5. Perfect Dark will be available for Xbox Series and PC. Release dates for both titles have yet to be announced.

item.title: Nintendo Music announced for iOS, Android – music streaming exclusively for Nintendo Switch Online members
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/10/nintendo-music-announced-for-ios-android-music-streaming-exclusively-for-nintendo-switch-online-members

  • Smartphone

Available now.

Nintendo has announced Nintendo Music, a new application for iOS and Android featuring music from various Nintendo titles. It is available now via App Store and Google Play, exclusively for Nintendo Switch Online members at no additional cost.

Here is an overview of the application, via Nintendo:

With Nintendo Music, you can stream songs right from the app or download them to the app for offline listening. Search for songs by game title, track name, playlist name or even browse by screenshot. Need background music while you work or study? You can loop songs or extend select tracks to 15, 30 or 60 minutes for uninterrupted listening. No need to worry about game spoilers either, because you can filter out soundtracks that may spoil certain moments for you.

Find your favorite songs and build personal playlists that you can share with others, or browse curated playlists created by Nintendo. You’ll also receive recommendations based on your Nintendo Switch Play Activity! More music will continue to be added to the app, so be sure to keep an ear out.

Reliving your musical memories from across Nintendo franchises—including Super Mario, The Legend of Zelda, Kirby, Pikmin, Metroid, Donkey Kong Country, and more—is now just a tap away!
